name: putter
content:
putter verb
(MOVE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I usually + adv/prep ] US (UK potter) to do things in a relaxed way, without rushing or trying very hard: He really enjoys puttering around in the garden.

putter verb
(MAKE NOISE)
[ I ] If a machine or engine putters, it makes a low sound repeatedly, showing that it is working slowly.

putter noun
(IN GOLF)
[ C ] a golf club (= stick for hitting a golf ball) with a short handle and metal end that is specially designed for putting
jhorrocks/E+/GettyImages
[ C ] someone who putts: He's a good putter.

putter noun
(WALK)
[ S ] US (UK potter) a slow, relaxed walk around a place

to move around without hurrying and in a relaxed and pleasant way: He really enjoys puttering in the garden.
